text:
someone playing with CSS Grid in HubSpot?
Seems like the minimization process breaks it. For now I am jumping it with {% raw %} but just wondering if HS support it?
CSS Grid is native css that should be supported just about everywhere. What specifically are you seeing happening?

I use css grid in HS all the time, haven’t seen any issues. 

Where I have seen issues in the past was using @supports with multiple conditions. HS fixed that though.
I use css grid all of the time.

I combine with @supports too, but my problem is that if I use some complex stuff in grid-template-columns property, basically is crop away, like:
grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(20.875em, 1fr) );
ahh, I haven’t tried doing that yet. I think those functions are definitely the problem. I would report it to HS support and link them to the file.
when I had my issue what was happening was the css file ended right at the @supports, in your case it will likely end right at the repeat()

Thank you Jon, 
In my case, I think the problem here is the minmax function which is not recognized yet and break all the below code
<https://new.skyslope.com/blog> uses grid.
then again this is wordpress. But <https://www.bluleadz.com/blog> is grid as well
<@U7ADCU3BM> you could try placing your css in the file manager.
not ideal if you want to edit using the design manager. but it will avoid these issues.

Anyone out there building pillar pages and running into issues with slow load times?  I'm looking into some options for lazy loading images (thanks for the great blog <@U7V9DQ31P>), but I'm wondering if anyone else has come up with any other good solutions.  I was also considering lazy loading all content on scroll with an AJAX call to a HUBDB
if you have iframes (videos, etc) you can lazy load those as well
we found that having more than a couple wistia videos on a page really slows it down
see our resources page for an example of lazy loading all the things: <https://www.bluleadz.com/resources>
powering it with HubDB makes it easier since you have full control over each item rather than trying to deal with content inside of a rich text area
Ian. That is a great idea… Are we sure google will index the content if it is lazy loaded on scroll?
Thank you Chad, with {% raw %} is enough to keep working in designer (we have that flow in the team with the file versions etc.)
<@U38EZFVFE> I hadn't quite considered that.  Seems like just sticking to lazy loading the heavier items might be the best choice here.
Wistia loads the poster image even iff you are not using the embedded iframe. or popover. .. it happens when you use the .js file that comes with ech embed script
google has said it uses javascript when indexing so they will still index
The text shouldnt slow dow the load time.
i think the reason you'd want to do that is because you can't control the markup in a rich text area
but if you're using structured custom modules/hubdb you probably don't need to. html is always the least heavy thing on a page.
Caution about the lazyloading thing - YES google uses Javascript HOWEVER -google bots are known to not scroll
learned the hard way with wow.js which works similar to many lazy loading scripts.
<https://moz.com/blog/google-css-javascript-hidden-text>
This is all great stuff to consider.  Thanks everyone

I think we're just going to investigate lazy loading images and videos at the moment and will investigate the potential of lazy loading everything.  The lack of control over html output of rich text modules in HUBDB is definitely a bit of an issue that could be addressed, but we'll do the best we can with the tools at hand.
agreed - wish they’d just make that the standard rich text field. wonder what their reasoning for not doing it was.
The Raw Html and Text shouldn’t slow down the page load times. But lazy loading all of the static assets will most surely increase your page speed to almost instant.
you can also offset the lazy load so that it happens just out of view. The user will almost never see it loading.
good call
Check out prefetching
or even preconnects if not on the same site.
can anyone confirm that "blog_recent_topic_posts" used in an RSS feed does not include archived items?
a client is stating an email he sent included archived blog posts and we can't find anywhere if this is possible or not
did this just happen? You can check the rss link and see if it is there
Just looking for verification on this. There is no structured data that is supplied by HS with pages/blogs right?
What do you mean by structured data/what are you looking for?
similar to this (i added the schema markup to this post) <https://search.google.com/structured-data/testing-tool#url=http%3A%2F%2Fwsol-2660159.hs-sites.com%2Fbusiness%2Fblog%2Fanother-sample-post>
<https://developers.google.com/search/docs/guides/intro-structured-data>

*HubSpot Devs - Design Manager 1 has a new annoying bug today - I call it “File Roulette”*
<https://spin.d.pr/zDT237+>

Seen this on multiple sites using design manager 1 today. Was not happening yesterday as far as I know.

Till it’s fixed I’m playing file roulette every time I try to switch files because the labels all disappear - so if I have a more than a handful of tabs open I can’t tell what they are till I click em.

Others at our office are seeing this issue too.
Same
Yes seeing it too
Seeing it as well

<https://spin.d.pr/XUvxvb+>

404 errors onClick of tabs other than “browse” tab
Do you know if the files were made in the old Design Manager or the new?

Any idea why the label on a form field gets tucked behind a thin white line? This issue is only present on Safari – the form works fine on chrome. 

Link to beta site: <http://697792.hs-sites.com/start-a-project> (open in safari to duplicate issue).
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
<@U22PWJ41G> still an issue, did you test in safari?
It appears to be due to line height
I quickly updated it to a random number (26px) and it seemed to fix the issue
Thanks!

So I am having some weird things with Analytics in HS. I have a page that shows we got direct traffic from two other pages on our site to it but the problem is there is zero linking to that page from those other pages
has anyone had issues like this?
im hoping someone from HS might be able to look into the analytics and see what I am seeing here
Do you have Google analytics? Maybe you can cross reference the HubSpot analytics and determine if you see anythign like that from GA -- might help determine what is going on
yea whats weird is that data doesnt have the referring pages on it
according to HS the direct traffic came from a case study on our main site and a landing page on a subdomain. But According to GA, the full referrer for that page is different pages alltogether
and alot more views are shown in GA then in HS
could try assigning a variable to be a "blog only" variable then using an expression test to check "is none".
Something like {% set var = group.id %}{% if var is none %} This probably isn't a blog {% endif %}

can someone explain what this part of the analytics code is:
//js.hs-analytics.net/analytics/`[13 digit number]`/`[this is portalid]`.js
the 13 digit number
its not an ISO date as thats 10 numbers
Can you post an example?
ill send it to you
It appears to be epoch milliseconds: <https://www.epochconverter.com/>
so for the analytics js, is this needed at all ?
it ensures you have the latest version
